member.name: T:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshClipProcedure
member.summary: Performs Clipping operations (Union, Intersection, Difference, Xor) between mesh faces that lie on the same plane.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshClipProcedure._inputSource
member.summary: The first/source/minuend mesh used in the clipping operation.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshClipProcedure._inputTarget
member.summary: The second/target/subtrahend mesh used in the clipping operation.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshClipProcedure._output
member.summary: Resulting mesh from the clipping operation.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshClipProcedure._parameterClipType
member.summary:
Type of clipping operation to apply.
Union means that the result is the sum of the face areas.
Intersection means that the result is the intersection of the faces areas.
Difference means that the result is the difference between the faces areas (where the target removes intersecting areas from the source).
Difference means that the result corresponds to the areas that do not overlap.

Faces means that the meshes will not exceed the indicated face count.
Vertices means that the meshes will not exceed the indicated vertex count.

member.summary: The maximum allowed count of faces or vertices to keep in each resulting mesh.

member.name: T:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshMergeProcedure
member.summary: Merges multiple meshes into a single one.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshMergeProcedure._input
member.summary:
The type of input port.
Setting a Single (square) input means that the node will be executed once for all meshes. Useful to merge any collection of meshes at once.
Setting a Dual (circles) input means that the node will be executed once for each pair of meshes. Useful to merge exactly two meshes at once.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshMergeProcedure._output
member.summary: The merged meshes, according to the defined criteria.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshMergeProcedure._parameterCriteria
member.summary: Criteria on which to group the meshes. If none is defined, all the meshes will be merged into one.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshMergeProcedure._parameterScopeMerge
member.summary:
How the scope for the merged meshes should be defined.
First: The scope from the first mesh will be selected and adapted to the new mesh size.
Reset: The scope will be reset, meaning that it will be aligned to the world axes.

member.name: T:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure
member.summary: Applies sequences of geometrical, scope or property transformations to the given input mesh.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure._parameterOperation
member.summary: The operation to be applied to the mesh.

member.name: T:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.LatheParameter
member.summary: Performs a lathe operation that creates a new mesh from rotating the input mesh around a given axis.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.LatheParameter._parameterAxis
member.summary: The axis around which the lathe operation should be performed.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.LatheParameter._parameterDistance
member.summary: Distance from the axis.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.LatheParameter._parameterSegments
member.summary: Number of segments that the created mesh should posses.

member.name: T:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.TriangulateParameter
member.summary: Triangulates the mesh so that the created mesh is only made out of triangles.

member.name: T:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.ManipulateNormalsParameter
member.summary: Updates the normal vectors at the mesh vertices.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.ManipulateNormalsParameter._parameterType
member.summary:
Type of normal calculation to perform.
Flat means that the normals of the vertices will match the corresponding face normal, creating a flat shading effect.
Smooth means that the normals of the vertices will be averaged from the faces they belong to, creating a smooth shading effect.

member.name: T:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.PyramidizeParameter
member.summary: Creates pyramid geometries from each mesh face.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.PyramidizeParameter._parameterHeight
member.summary: The height of the created pyramids.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.PyramidizeParameter._parameterCap
member.summary: Indicate if the original face should be included in the final result as well

member.name: T:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.ConvexifyParameter
member.summary: Replaces the mesh faces with convex polygonal ones.

member.name: T:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.SpherifyParameter
member.summary: Creates hemisphere geometries from each mesh face.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.SpherifyParameter._parameterHeight
member.summary: Height of the hemispheres.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.SpherifyParameter._parameterCircleSectionAngle
member.summary: Angle defining the hemisphere curvature.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.SpherifyParameter._parameterSegments
member.summary: Number of segments to interpolate the hemispheres..

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.SpherifyParameter.CapParameter
member.summary: Indicate if the original face should be included in the final result as well

member.name: T:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.SimplifyParameter
member.summary: Simplifies faces of the mesh by removing vertices which do not introduce a noticeable detail.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.SimplifyParameter._parameterAngleTolerance
member.summary: The angle tolerance, in degrees. Vertices whose edge angles differ less than this value from 180 degrees (meaning that they are rather straight) are removed.

member.name: T:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.OffsetParameter
member.summary: Replaces all faces with offset versions that either go inward or outward.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.OffsetParameter._parameterAmount
member.summary: Amount to be offset.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.OffsetParameter._attributeSection
member.summary: Attribute where the type of created face will be stored. Resulting faces of this operation will have this attribute set at either "Inside" or "Outside".

member.name: M:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.OffsetParameter.OffsetInside(Sceelix.Meshes.Data.MeshEntity,Sceelix.Meshes.Data.Face,System.Single)
member.summary: Offsets a given shape to the inside.
member.param: Amount of offset. Must be a positive value.
member.returns: The inside of the offset. The outside faces are added to the passed MeshEntity.

member.name: M:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshModifyProcedure.OffsetParameter.OffsetOutside(Sceelix.Meshes.Data.MeshEntity,Sceelix.Meshes.Data.Face,System.Single)
member.summary: Offsets a given MeshEntity to the outside.
member.param: Amount of offset. Must be a positive value.
member.returns: The outside of the offset. The passed MeshEntity remains unaltered.

member.name: T:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshLoadProcedure
member.summary: Loads Meshes from disk from standard formats.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshLoadProcedure._output
member.summary: The loaded mesh entity.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshLoadProcedure._parameterFileName
member.summary: Name of the file to load.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshLoadProcedure._parameterRotateAxis
member.summary: Rotates the loaded meshes by 90 around the X-Axis. Useful to compensate for differences in the Up vector, since many systems use Y-Up, while Sceelix uses Z-up.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshLoadProcedure._parameterFlipFaces
member.summary: Flips all mesh faces. Useful to compensate for differences in face winding order (clockwise vs. counterclockwise).

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshLoadProcedure._parameterFlipTexture
member.summary: Flips the V coordinate for all texture coordinates. Useful to compensate for differences in UV setup (V-Up or V-Down).

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshLoadProcedure._parameterLoadMaterials
member.summary: Indicates if the materials should also be loaded. Default is True.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshLoadProcedure._parameterResetAbsolutePaths
member.summary: Indicates if the referenced files/textures, if defined with absolute paths, should be reset and made relative to the defined "Texture Folder" parameter. This is useful when the models were save with absolute paths referencing paths from other computers.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshLoadProcedure._textureFolder
member.summary: Folder name/path, relative to the file, where the textures can be found. Useful to compensate for possible mismatches between the locations indicated in the imported file and the actual texture locations. For example: "Textures", "../Images", "Files/Textures", etc.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshLoadProcedure._attributeName
member.summary: Name of the attribute that should store the "Name" of the mesh.

member.name: T:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshSaveProcedure
member.summary: Saves meshes to disk in standard formats.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshSaveProcedure._parameterInput
member.summary:
The type of input port.
Setting a Single (circle) input means that the node will be executed once per mesh. Useful when different meshes are meant to be sent to different files, in which case the file path should be set as an expression.
Setting a Collective (square) input means that the node will be executed once for all meshes. Useful to export all meshes into one file.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshSaveProcedure._output
member.summary: The mesh that was saved to file.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Meshes.Procedures.MeshSaveProcedure._parameterFormat
member.summary: The file format to export to.

member.summary: Indicates if the faces should be flipped. This may be required for exporting to certain platforms where the face orientation is different.
